You will enjoy small plates and unique apps at this beautiful modern restaurant located at the Amari Spa. Fusion drinks are delicious. Comfy lounge with couch seating, main restaurant, or outdoor seating with fire pits are options for dining, all with an amazing view !

We had a very pleasant dinner here. The food was better than we had any reason to expect, and the wait staff was eager and helpful. The venue is a bit noisy, but not so much you can't hear one another. It's in a hotel lobby, a tiny bit off the beaten path off the main shopping drag in Sedona,...

Lovely view of the red rocks, great food and nearly perfect service sums up our experience at this restaurant. The prices are a tad high but the flavors were extremely original and delicious.

I will say the food was very good there as well as the service. Had Christmas Eve meal there, from the valet parking to the food, to the service, to the desert, everything is perfect.
The price is a little bit high but it is good to enjoy your vacation.

Had dinner in this place yesterday. The food was excellent. Being European it was a pleasure that quality won over quantity. The quality of ingredients and the cooking was superb.
Service was average and the hierarchy celebrated of the respective people in charge was too obvious. Missed the personal touch. Arrived 75 min before time of dinner reservation. No chance...

Went for Restaurant Week - a 3 course dinner for $33. 3 choices for each course: first course was Corn Soup, Roasted Corn, and Salad; second course was Salmon, Chicken, Roasted Squash, then deserts - Dulce de Leche, Chocolate Torte, Vanilla Ice Cream. Good selection we thought, and went with the Roasted Corn & Salad - the corn was delicious...

Located in The Amara resort, if you sit on the patio you will have one of the best views in Sedona! We only ordered drinks and guacamole..but it was fabulous!

Had the Chicken Tostada (at $12)...and it was about half the size of a kid's burger--seriously tiny and insufficient. GREAT dish, but up the price to $20 and make a meal out of it, would ya?
Was still hungry so ordered the Fish Tacos. NICE Mahi, great slaw, and all ingredients complimented each other quite well.
Went for the "craft"...

review_list:
Best huevos rancheros in town! We always have breakfast here at least once when in town, great food & service!

Laid back restaurant. Family atmosphere. Decent portion sizes. Great service. Decent value for what you get for your dollar spent.

I've enjoyed breakfast at Nick's numerous times and the same was true on this visit. Lots of choices, prices are reasonable for the quality and quantity of food served, the place is always well-staffed with friendly service, and the food is above average. I had the Vegetable Omelette on this visit and it was very good. Our waitress on this...

Big portions and friendly service. This is a place where you feel at home straight away. Good food and a family owned touch makes this a great place to visit when in West Sedona!

The food was very good and the selection for breakfast was great too. The staff are super friendly and the place is a nice, comfortable place to eat. Am going to try their lunch next time.

This restaurant was recommended for breakfast, but the breakfast was nothing special, the place was unattractive, and it was no bargain either.

Hands down the best breakfast around. Good service and nice variety in the menu. Everything came out of the kitchen hot and tasty. A friendly, local atmosphere. Sometimes dining out in Sedona you can run into let's say a very "snooty" atmosphere. Not so at Nicks.

So delicious and large portions! I loved their Corned Beef Hash! Real corned beef, bits of onions and pepper and potatoes. It was the best Corned Beef Hash thus far in my life! They substituted tomatoes for eggs. The home potatoes have onions and green peppers. They added Garlic and Cheese for me which was so nice. My friend ordered...


More  



If this is where the locals go, I wonder why. Service is S-L-O-W and less than friendly (they're really understaffed). Ambiance is lacking. Food quality is decent, not great. We went on Taco Tuesday night. If you're interested in good Mexican, I suggest you go elsewhere.

Whether you're running on empty or want to split a meal, Nick's has what you're looking for. A funny combination of BBQ and Mexican food, Nick's can satisfy anyone's desire great "home cooked" food. Friendly and welcoming, the bar and dining room pay close attention to one thing - you!
title: Nick's on the West Side, Sedona

review_list:
Breakfast was great, but very pricey for what we got. The service was excellent and the food was good but we were not expecting a $40 bill for two breakfasts. I think this might be normal for Sedona though.

Visitng Sedona, looking for lunch and were pleasantly surprised by the interor of HP Cafe. Food choices were good and very tasty, and service was friendly.

We stumbled across HP Cafe while walking by our hotel. A small but quaint place with seating inside or outside. Pan fried chicken with mushroom gravy was excellent and a very generous portion. Crab cake appetizer was very good as well. We are returning for breakfast!

We took a day trip to Sedona from Pheonix and wandered into the H P Cafe. It is a small restaurant that offers gluten free sandwiches. Yeah. Nice little cafe that serves a realy nice breakfast. Wait staff are very pleasant. Not many places in Uptown serve a Full Breakfast so this is a great spot!!

The veggie black bean and beet burger was excellent as well as the quinoa beet salad. Service is excellent. We went for lunch and heard others saying their food was good too. Looks a bit like an Asian restaurant inside which was odd but the food makes it worth it

Grabbed breakfast at the HP Cafe our first morning in Sedona. What a wonderful start to our trip!
Our host Brandon was very warm and made a fantastic cappuccino! The place is very pleasing to the eye and the menu is excellent! We would definitely eat there again!!

What a cute little Cafe. We had breakfast here on our recent trip to Sedona. The ambiance was very relaxing and clean. Our server was very nice and helpful. He recommended the Southwest classic burrito which was very delicious and arrived very quick also. I would definitely come back to this restaurant next time I am in Sedona.

I'm in Sedona visiting from Phoenix and needed brunch. This place serves breakfast lunch and dinner. Thy have a full bar. I had a sandwich which was delicious. It was relaxing with great views of the red rocks.

Went there at around 4 pm, they let us order from both the lunch and dinner menu.
My girl liked her salmon, my veggie burger was just ok. Seems lake a slightly upscale type menu.

We thought that we were ordering from a different restaurant. We found their menu online (and saw that they were Zagat rated) so we decided to go--my brother wanted sushi for his birthday. More  



If sushi is what you are looking for, you may want to reconsider this choice. We don't like seaweed wrap on our sushi and asked for soy paper. It was the thickest, heaviest soy paper we've ever been served. The sushi was acceptable but just barely.

This place puts Japanese restaurants in Japan to shame! The best Sushi Shokunin one can find in at least AZ if not further out.
Fresh sushi and sashimi are cut to perfection served alongside more traditional Japanese village fare. Perfect place to round out a day spent hiking and touring in the area.

If you're looking for hip new young Americanized sushi like you're used to getting everywhere else this is not the place for you. This is extremely authentic. The edemame is served cold as it should be. The menu is extremely limited and just perfect the way it is. There are zero Americanized "specialty" rolls on the menu. A fresh towel...


More  



Had a very pleasant authentic Japanese meal served by friendly staff in a relaxing ambience. Easy to recommend this to others.

I wasn't going to eat sushi in AZ, however, I wanted steamed fresh vegetables after a long travel. Poor selection, it was just carrots, broccoli, onions, and cauliflower. I expected more variety for $15. Edamame was cold and unsalted. Miso was so so.
I really wanted the ginger ice cream but couldn't in good faith give this establishment another penny....


More  



The biggest downside about living in Sedona is the scarcity of good ethnic food. After coming here from the SF bay area, I found Minami, and that has taken care of my Japanese food cravings for years. It's a small place, with a single sushi chef and perhaps 20 seats. As at any good sushi place, just ask for what's...


More  



Walk into the ambiance of the Japanese Culture. Visit Minami for an asian experience of taste and color. The dishes are served with artful design. Choose for a wide menu to entice all ages to savor the flare of Japan. Mid range prices an up.

I've only got one thing to say about Japanese restaurants and sushi restaurants in Arizona, where's the nearest beach. You know from that statement that the fish is not fresh it's probably frozen.

The owner has a reputation that he proved true to form when I went. I had been once before and he expected me me to know what is and isn't available on the menu. Wasn't very nice, but the sushi is always pretty good.

An artificial intelliegence greets you when you literally cross the threshold.
Robot like people put together your sandwich lacking flair, enthusiasm, kindness.
Deadwood feeling , eat fresh/eat fast and scram !
The owner is clearly not present or lacks 'Basic training' skills.
McDonalds here locally has high work standards and great training, what a difference a mile makes ?

went to eat some sandwiches and saw a special the waiter helped us and we got our food quick, with great customer service and some cookies.

Good, fast service and Italian BMT is a great sandwich. Get the foot long and share! My 5-year old granddaughter really enjoys this choice with the vinagrette dressing.

I wanted a tuna sandwich (I've been there before for the same sandwich) and decided to use the drive thru this time. It was fine, easy (like most drive thrus) and it was a good sandwich. If you like your hometown Subway, chances are you'll like this one, too.

What happened to "Truth in Advertising?" I have tried several times and have yet to get a sandwich that even comes close to resembling the pictures in their advertising. I may try one more time and if it doesn't live up to the their pictures it will be the last time.

title: Full Moon Saloon, Sedona

review_list:
We stopped here after touring the area all day. Steak was delicious and cooked to perfection. Rattlesnake trio was a great conversation piece as a starter. Service friendly and efficient. Very well situated for all Sedona attractions, right opposite Pink Jeep Tours HQ.

The western-style atmosphere is fun and makes this place a good stop. We stopped in the afternoon to refresh from our adventures with a beer and appetizers. We had the sampler plate of appetizers because we wanted to try the rattlesnake and prickly pear fries, which were OK.

I visited this restaurant on a Saturday morning and the food was Very good. Their cups of coffee are gigantic and the food is prepared fresh to order. I ad the Open Face Egg sandwich, which was excellent. It was 2 eggs cooked medium served on toast with roasted asparagus, goat cheese and fresh dill. Very good.

Would you like to try rattlesnake or buffalo? Try the sampler and you will get a good sampling of a variety of unusual foods. The servers here were wonderful and answered many questions about the food and Sedona . A fun place to go for lunch!

A nice place to sit and enjoy the area. We sat outside and loved the beautiful weather we had. The food was great and the staff was fast and pleasant.

Good selection of wild game and domestic food on menu. Prices were reasonable, other than slight mixup on order would visit again.

We went here for lunch based on what we read on the Web. The service was average and the Prickly Pear margarita was not as good as their sister restaurant, The Barking Frog. On the bright side, my wife had the Elk Chops which were very good and I had the Buffalo Burger, also very tasty.

The menu and restaurant were from th past. A favorite of the movie stars and their stories when they filmed in the area. The menu was fine, service was so-so, and the meal was just OK! Stil was a fun place to go!
